channel.title: 3D Television
channel.description: What's the general opinion here? Too expensive? Is it just a quick, popular obsession that will blow over in time? I think that while it could just be a flavor of the month (year in reality) thing, even if it blows over the 3D would work great in FPS games. The Panasonic Viera VT25 3D has the best 2D picture of all time as well, I was in Best Buy yesterday and looked at the 3D on it and it was amazing.

item.title: 3D Television
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
I can appreciate the merits of both Avatar and Inception.

You might think that Avatar is simply space Pocahontas (or space Ferngully or space Dances with Wolves) with special effects, but I really enjoyed it regardless. Just because it doesn’t have an original story doesn’t mean that it’s not good.

Hell, Black Mesa is going to be the same game as a game from over a decade ago but with updated “special effects”, and we’re all antsy for it.

I hated the movie “The Watchmen” to the point of loathing and even walked out of it in the theaters (which I’ve never done in the past) but, it’s a “good movie that I didn’t like”. I didn’t really enjoy Inception, though, even though Ellen Page was hawt.

Meanwhile, you have a movie like “Howard the Duck” which was a horrible movie that was fun and enjoyable.

To me, “good/bad movie” is not the same thing as “liked/disliked the movie”.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Television
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
avatar wasn’t good because it was pocahontas in space + awesome special effects.

inception was a very good idea but poorly executed: shitty pacing and almost no character development.

this is of course a matter of opinion, but when we are discussing movies , opinion it’s all we’ve got.

EDIT: also, check the black text in my previous post…

Why do you think anime characters have eyes bigger than normal? Because it expresses emotions better.

That is the main thing that helps it’s creators to f**k audiences minds…

Fuskox:

Well I made this thread because we had ordered a Panasonic 3D VT25 so I could see what people think about 3D. I’ll tell you how it is when it’s delivered, Saturday I think I’ll be getting it. Mainly excited for games in it.

Let me know how you connected everything together. I was always curious if you’ll be using Nvidia’s or Panasonic’s glasses and how do you synchronize them together…

item.title: 3D Television
item.dc:creator: gugamilare
item.description:
sersoft:

sometimes people get killed due to simple logic, do you wanna die?

Feel free to come and kill me if that is what you want

Fancy Pants:

anime is shit because it’s lazy, not just because it’s simple. it being simple comes from the laziness. it’s just plain not good. it’s not aesthetically pleasing. ANYONE can do it, it requires no talent.

When creating the movie Ponyo, Hayao Myiazaki insisted in drawing the sea and waves himself without any help, by hand. He prefers drawing over using the computer, and yet the elements (people, vehicles, etc) of his movies often make some very complex movements. And that man is fucking 69 years old. Lazy? I don’t think so.

I’m not talking about general anime, Dragon Ball, Pokemon and stuff, those are shitty. As a matter of fact, I’ve not seen any anime that look like art other than Myizaki’s movies. Not that I’ve seen many of them, though, so maybe I’m not even talking about anime at all.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D Television
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
gugamilare:

I was just showing the flaw in your argument. You said anime is shit because it is easy to do. So, according to this reasoning, anything that is easy to do is shit. Van Gogh is easy to do; therefore, Van Gogh is shit. Simple logic

anime is shit because it’s lazy, not just because it’s simple. it being simple comes from the laziness. it’s just plain not good. it’s not aesthetically pleasing. ANYONE can do it, it requires no talent.
